page.title: 02Blackwater Village
page.content: {Blackwater}is no longer the agricultur -al settlement it was. Very few of the l20 people who live there actually do work there. There is a central group of 35 houses and in common with other local villages there is a{mixture of {architectural styles and materials. The houses date from pre-Elizabethan to the present day.{Stone House}is documented from l535.{The Mill House operates as a Short Stay Home and the Pond has been extended for use as a Trout Farm. The Blacksmith works from the refurbished stable block and he still uses the{200yr old Forge}across the road. A set of shoes costs Â£16. {Blackwater Garage}are B.M.W.Agents. {Farmgate Meats}are a farm based Butch -er's Shop.{Radcliffe's}run a market garden and sell fruit and vegetables on a 'Cash and Carry' basis.
